docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: A Flet extension using flutter_secure_storage.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Install with pip: 

pip install flet-secure-storage

or with uv: 

uv add flet-secure-storage

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
import flet as ft

import flet_secure_storage as fss


def main(page: ft.Page):

    secure_storage = fss.SecureStorage() # Create an instance of secure_storage
    page.services.append(secure_storage) # Add secure_storage to services

    # API Calls here

    page.add(
        ft.Text("Quick Start")
    )

ft.run(main)

docs.title: Initilize Class
docs.text:
import flet_secure_storage as fss

secure_storage = fss.SecureStorage() # Create an instance of secure_storage

page.services.append(secure_storage) # Add secure_storage to services

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text:
Bases: Service

Create an instance of FlutterSecureStorage in Flet https://pub.dev/packages/flutter_secure_storage https://github.com/juliansteenbakker/flutter_secure_storage

The functions used are to mirror the client_storage calls https://docs.flet.dev/cookbook/client-storage/

docs.title: clear async
docs.text:
clear()

Clears all data from secure storage. From flutter_secure_storage: storage.deleteAll

Returns:

Name Type Description bool bool

True if the storage was cleared successfully, False otherwise.

Source code in src\flet_secure_storage\secure_storage.py 
async def clear(self) -> bool:
    """
    Clears all data from secure storage.
    From flutter_secure_storage: storage.deleteAll

    Returns:
        bool: True if the storage was cleared successfully, False otherwise.
    """
    return await self._invoke_method("clear")

docs.title: contains_key async
docs.text:
contains_key(key)

Checks if a key exists in secure storage. From flutter_secure_storage: storage.containsKey

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default key str

The key to check for existence.

required

Returns:

Name Type Description bool bool

True if the key exists, False otherwise.

Source code in src\flet_secure_storage\secure_storage.py 
async def contains_key(self, key: str) -> bool:
    """
    Checks if a key exists in secure storage.
    From flutter_secure_storage: storage.containsKey

    Args:
        key (str): The key to check for existence.

    Returns:
        bool: True if the key exists, False otherwise.
    """
    return await self._invoke_method("contains_key", {"key": key})

docs.title: get async
docs.text:
get(key)

Retrieves a value from secure storage. From flutter_secure_storage: storage.read

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default key str

The key to retrieve the value for.

required

Returns:

Type Description Optional[str]

Optional[str]: The value associated with the key as a string, or None if not found.

Source code in src\flet_secure_storage\secure_storage.py 
async def get(self, key: str) -> Optional[str]:
    """
    Retrieves a value from secure storage.
    From flutter_secure_storage: storage.read

    Args:
        key (str): The key to retrieve the value for.

    Returns:
        Optional[str]: The value associated with the key as a string, or None if not found.
    """
    return await self._invoke_method("get", {"key": key})

docs.title: get_keys async
docs.text:
get_keys(key_prefix)

Retrieves all keys from secure storage. From flutter_secure_storage: storage.readAll

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default key_prefix str

The prefix to filter keys by.

required

Returns:

Type Description list[str]

list[str]: Returns a list of keys [:] of the values that match the key_prefix or all keys if the user enters and empty string or None Source code in src\flet_secure_storage\secure_storage.py 

async def get_keys(self, key_prefix: Optional[str]) -> list[str]:
    """
    Retrieves all keys from secure storage.
    From flutter_secure_storage: storage.readAll

    Args:
        key_prefix (str): The prefix to filter keys by.

    Returns:
        list[str]: Returns a list of keys [<key_prefix>:<value>] of the values
                   that match the key_prefix or all keys if the user enters and
                   empty string or None
    """
    key_prefix = key_prefix or ""
    response: dict[str, str] = await self._invoke_method("get_keys")

    return [
        f"{key}:{value}"
        for key, value in response.items()
        if key.startswith(key_prefix)
    ]

docs.title: remove async
docs.text:
remove(key)

Deletes a key from the secure storage. From flutter_secure_storage: storage.delete

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default key str

The key to delete.

required

Name Type Description bool bool

True if the key was deleted successfully, False otherwise.

Source code in src\flet_secure_storage\secure_storage.py 
async def remove(self, key: str) -> bool:
    """
    Deletes a key from the secure storage.
    From flutter_secure_storage: storage.delete

    Args:
        key (str): The key to delete.

    Returns:
        bool: True if the key was deleted successfully, False otherwise.
    """
    return await self._invoke_method("remove", {"key": key})

docs.title: set async
docs.text:
set(key, value)

Sets a value in secure storage. From flutter_secure_storage: storage.write

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default key str

key name, used to retrieve the value

required value Any

value to store

required

Returns:

Name Type Description bool bool

True if the value was stored successfully, False otherwise

Source code in src\flet_secure_storage\secure_storage.py 
async def set(self, key: str, value: Any) -> bool:
    """
    Sets a value in secure storage.
    From flutter_secure_storage: storage.write

    Args:
        key (str): key name, used to retrieve the value
        value (Any): value to store

    Returns:
        bool: True if the value was stored successfully, False otherwise
    """
    assert value is not None
    return await self._invoke_method("set", {"key": key, "value": value})

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text:
A list of API calls for the flet-secure-storage flet extension.

Bases: Service

Create an instance of FlutterSecureStorage in Flet https://pub.dev/packages/flutter_secure_storage https://github.com/juliansteenbakker/flutter_secure_storage

The functions used are to mirror the client_storage calls https://docs.flet.dev/cookbook/client-storage/

Retrieves all keys from secure storage. From flutter_secure_storage: storage.readAll

The prefix to filter keys by.

required

Type Description list[str]

async def get_keys(self, key_prefix: Optional[str]) -> list[str]:
    """
    Retrieves all keys from secure storage.
    From flutter_secure_storage: storage.readAll

    Args:
        key_prefix (str): The prefix to filter keys by.

    Returns:
        list[str]: Returns a list of keys [<key_prefix>:<value>] of the values
                   that match the key_prefix or all keys if the user enters and
                   empty string or None
    """
    key_prefix = key_prefix or ""
    response: dict[str, str] = await self._invoke_method("get_keys")

    return [
        f"{key}:{value}"
        for key, value in response.items()
        if key.startswith(key_prefix)
    ]

docs.title: Build from Source
docs.text: Use this section if you would like to make changes to the source code for your own project.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Git
  • UV Astral
  • Python 3.10+

docs.title: Prepare the Environment
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository to the location of your choosing.

    git clone https://github.com/td3447/flet-secure-storage.git

  2. From the root directory, install flet with uv.

    uv sync

  3. Change to the build directory.

    cd examples/flet_secure_storage_example

  4. Build the project (initially). Choose your system (windows, macos, etc.)

    uv run flet build <system>

docs.title: Building wheel for PyPi
docs.text:
• Build extension

    Build for Windows
    cd examples/flet_secure_storage_example
flet build windows

    or

    Build for Android
    cd examples/flet_secure_storage_example
flet build apk

  • Start from root, where overall pyproject.toml is located

  • Install modules 

    uv run pip install --upgrade build


    uv run py -m build
    output
    Successfully built flet_secure_storage-0.2.0.tar.gz and flet_secure_storage-0.2.0-py3-none-any.whl
    Build for PyPi
    uv run pip install --upgrade twine

  • Create .pypirc file C:/Users//.pypirc with the following contents .pypirc

    [distutils]
index-servers = pypi

[pypi]
username = __token__
password = pypi-XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX  <- token from PyPi

  • Upload to PyPi

    uv run twine upload dist/*

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: This page provides concise, actionable troubleshooting steps for common build and runtime issues with the flet-secure-storage examples, including error context, likely causes, and verified fixes.

docs.title: List of Issues
docs.text: • Flet Build Windows Fails

docs.title: Build Variables:
docs.text:
• Installed Flutter version 3.38.3
pubspec.yaml
dependencies:
  flet: ^0.80.0
  flutter:
    sdk: flutter
  flutter_secure_storage: ^10.0.0

docs.title: Command:
docs.text:
uv run flet build windows -v

Issue

Error building Flet app - see the log of failed command above.

  • Detailed Issue:
Building Windows application...
        C:\flet-secure-storage\examples\flet_secure_storage_example\build\flutter\windows\flutter\ephemeral\.plugin_symlinks\screen_brightness_windows\wind
        ows\include\screen_brightness_windows\screen_brightness_windows_plugin.h(6,10): error C1083: Cannot open include file:
        '../include/screen_brightness_windows/screen_brightness_changed_stream_handler.h': No such file or directory
        [C:\flet-secure-storage\examples\flet_secure_storage_example\build\flutter\build\windows\x64\runner\flet_secure_storage_example.vcxproj]
        Building Windows application...                                    15.4s
        Build process failed.

docs.title: Fix:
docs.text:
• Open File: "C:\flet-secure-storage\examples\flet_secure_storage_example\build\flutter\windows\flutter\ephemeral.plugin_symlinks\screen_brightness_windows\windows\include\screen_brightness_windows\screen_brightness_windows_plugin.h"

    • Replace: 
      #include "../include/screen_brightness_windows/screen_brightness_changed_stream_handler.h"
    • With: 
      #include "screen_brightness_changed_stream_handler.h"

  • Rebuild:

uv run flet build windows -v
  • Expected Outcome: 
    Successfully built your Windows app! 🥳 Find it in build\windows directory. 📁

Console Output

Successfully built your Windows app! 🥳 Find it in build\windows directory. 📁
